page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO AREA
page.content: This area is almost entirely rural. There are four small villages (all with churches) and a total approximate population of 5OO. The overall impression is of quiet communities of people who get on with their own lives preferring to involve themselves in local life on a very selective basis. Families with children are obviously involved more with each other but there are many older couples whose children have moved away who are passing their retirement years in these villages. There are village fetes - this year a{Village Open Day in Flyford - Barbecues etc. but these occur in summer. During the winter months there is little activity save at Christmas. The farming is mainly cattle, milk and summer wheat; production is often dictated by EEC and Government grants.
